author: Sylvan Lane
description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Bill Pulte's war against Powell ramps up The overseer of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac is waging an online battle to force out Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, shattering norms along the way. © The Associated...
title: FHFA chief takes aim at Fed

author: Rachel Frazin
description: How to phase out Biden-era green energy tax credits is emerging as a key flashpoint among Senate Republicans as they seek to advance their version of the “big, beautiful bill.” The Senate is taking an approach to the credits for climate-friendly energy that is less aggressive than the House but still represents a major rollback...
title: Green energy credits phaseout divides Senate Republicans

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: A majority of surveyed Republicans say they support same-sex marriage, according to new data from a trio of polling firms. In the poll, provided exclusively to The Hill, 56 percent of Republicans say they agree that same-sex couples should have the right to marry each other, while 42 percent say they disagree. When given a...
title: Majority of Republicans support same-sex marriage, new polling shows

author: Joseph Choi
description: Presented by Alliance for Aging Research — Senate GOP leaders are looking to cut a deal with members of their conference who have balked at the impact of Medicaid cuts on rural hospitals.  {beacon} Health Care Health Care   The Big Story  GOP leadership negotiates with Medicaid holdouts Senate GOP leaders are looking to cut...
title: GOP leaders negotiate with Medicaid holdouts​

author: Jonathan Easley
description: Evening Report is The Hill's p.m. newsletter. Click here to sign up or subscribe below: THE WHITE HOUSE said Thursday that President Trump will make his decision on whether to strike Iran’s nuclear sites over the next two weeks, giving negotiators time to reach a diplomatic solution. Press secretary Karoline Leavitt read a statement from Trump to reporters in the...
title: Trump starts countdown on Iran

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence warned in a new essay that the conservative movement is being threatened by populist fervor and the transformation into the anti-woke movement, while the White House rejected the characterizations in Pence's piece.
title: Pence: American right facing 'existential identity crisis'

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Jasmine Crockett (D-Texas) said she doesn’t feel safe following the Minnesota lawmaker shootings this weekend and called for increased funding to help members of Congress pay for their own security. “No, not at all,” Crockett said Thursday on ABC’s “The View” when asked if she feels safe “as an elected official in this political...
title: Crockett on whether she feels safe after Minnesota shootings: 'Not at all'

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The overseer of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac is waging an online battle to force out Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Over the span of 24 hours, Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA) Director Bill Pulte has written or shared more than dozen posts on social media calling for Powell's resignation or sharing the rationale for...
title: Fannie, Freddie overseer wages online war against Fed chief

author: Tara Suter
description: Former NATO Supreme Allied Commander James Stavridis said Thursday he sees a 2 in 3 chance President Trump strikes Iran. “I think it's a close call for the president,” Stavridis told CNN’s Pamela Brown on “The Situation Room,” in an interview highlighted by Mediaite. "At this point, Pamela, I would say there's a 2 in...
title: Ex-NATO commander sees 2 in 3 chance Trump strikes Iran

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump’s border czar Tom Homan said Thursday that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) would resume “worksite enforcement” operations to ensure employees at farms and hotels are legally residing in the United States.  “I mean, we will concentrate on worksites on a prioritized basis just like we do at large operations,” Homan told reporters at...
title: Border czar vows 'worksite enforcement' at 'farms and hotels' after Trump remarks

author: Brett Samuels
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers said Thursday they denied Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents entry to their stadium grounds. "This morning, ICE agents came to Dodger Stadium and requested permission to access the parking lots. They were denied entry to the grounds by the organization. Tonight’s game will be played as scheduled," the Dodgers posted...
title: LA Dodgers deny ICE access to stadium grounds

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Policies that have banned or imposed fees on plastic bags are leading to significant declines in plastic litter along U.S. shorelines, a new study has found. These state- and local-level regulations have brought about a 25 percent to 47 percent plunge in the proportion of bags in total coastal littler cleanups, in comparison to places...
title: Plastic bag bans are helping clean up US coastlines: Study

description: US Steel said Wednesday it finalized its merger with Japan’s largest steelmaker, Nippon.  President Trump lauded the acquisition as a partnership in which the U.S. would maintain a “golden share” of profits with expanded investments in Pennsylvania, Indiana, Arkansas, Minnesota and Alabama.  “U. S. Steel will remain rooted in the United States and continue to...
title: US Steel, Nippon Steel finalize 'historic partnership'

author: Julia Manchester
description: Florida Attorney General James Uthmeier pitched a new facility to hold immigrants in the Everglades called “Alligator Alcatraz."  Uthmeier said in a video posted Thursday to social platform X that the location “presents an efficient, low cost opportunity to build a temporary detention facility because you don’t need to invest that much in the perimeter. If people...
title: Florida attorney general pitches 'Alligator Alcatraz' to hold migrants

author: Alex Gangitano
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt sidestepped a question Thursday over potential U.S. involvement in a regime change in Iran, as President Trump weighs his options on action amid the unrest in the Middle East. Leavitt, during a press briefing, was asked whether assisting with plans for regime change in Tehran is at all on...
title: White House sidesteps question on Iranian regime change

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Iran's Fordow nuclear site, hidden in a mountain south of Tehran, has become a focal point in the escalating Israel-Iran conflict as the U.S. considers stepping in to help Israel topple Tehran's nuclear capabilities.
title: What is Iran's secretive Fordow site?

author: Addy Bink
description: A heat dome is going to make it hot and sticky for parts of the U.S. this weekend.
title: What should your thermostat be set at during summer?

author: Taylor Delandro
description: The study revealed that just 10 grams of alcohol daily raises pancreatic cancer risks by 3 percent
title: Alcohol linked to increased risk of pancreatic cancer: Study

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump is expected to make a decision about whether to take direct action against Iran in the next two weeks, he said Thursday in a message delivered through his spokesperson. White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt told reporters at a briefing that she had a message directly from Trump in response to speculation about...
title: Leavitt: Trump to decide on Iran action in next 2 weeks

author: Rep. Tony Gonzales (R-Texas), opinion contributor
description: The New World screwworm parasite has been detected in Mexico, prompting the U.S. Agriculture Department to launch an $8.5 million sterile fly production facility in South Texas to prevent an outbreak in the U.S.
title: Lawmakers, USDA seek to combat New World screwworm along the southern border

author: Nicole Rogers
description: Americans caught in the crossfire are heading back to the U.S. thanks, in part, to Florida officials.
title: Americans fleeing Israel on evacuation flights to Florida

author: Cate Martel
description: Happy Thursday — It’s Juneteenth! It’s a fairly quiet day in Washington for the federal holiday, but it’s a workday at the White House. Oh, and today is the last full day of spring! 🌷 In today's issue: 🌍 IRAN LATEST A penny for your thoughts: President Trump pushed back on The Wall Street Journal’s reporting that he has OKed an...
title: Trump disputes Iran attack plan report; TikTok deadline extended

author: Brett Samuels
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk swiped at a senior White House official late Wednesday following reports of a rift between the two men.  Musk replied to a post on X, the social media platform he owns, linking to a New York Post story detailing that Sergio Gor had not submitted full vetting paperwork. Gor is one of the...
title: Musk slams influential Trump adviser: 'He's a snake'

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The world may be on track to breach 1.5 degrees Celsius of global warming in about three years, a group of scientists is warning in a new paper. Researchers have called for keeping the planet’s warming to less than 1.5 degrees Celsius (2.7 degrees Fahrenheit) to avoid the worst impacts of climate change. An update on the...
title: 1.5 degree warming threshold could be breached in about 3 years, scientists warn

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: President Trump signed an executive order Thursday extending the deadline for TikTok's parent company to divest the popular video sharing app by 90 days. The order punts the deadline for China-based ByteDance to September 17. The most recent deadline was Thursday. "I’ve just signed the Executive Order extending the Deadline for the TikTok closing for...
title: Trump signs order extending TikTok ban deadline

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Hundreds of people gathered outside the Minnesota State Capitol in St. Paul at dusk Wednesday for a candlelight vigil held in remembrance of slain state Rep. Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband, Mark. The Hortmans were gunned down at their home over the weekend by a shooter impersonating a law enforcement officer, surveillance video showed....
title: Hundreds mourn slain Minnesota lawmaker, husband at vigil

author: Cara Erdheim Kilgallen, opinion contributor
description: I have taught on a university campus for close to two decades, but only recently have I started to give some consideration to comedy as a serious source of study.
title: Colleges need more comedy

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: It was feisty and intermittently unpleasant — for them at least. It was madly entertaining for viewers.
title: Robby's Radar: Tucker Carlson destroys Ted Cruz on Iran-Israel, and why mainstream media love war

author: Jared Gans
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) has endorsed Democrat Rebecca Cooke in her attempt for a rematch against Rep. Derrick Van Orden (R-Wis.) in a battleground Wisconsin district.  Sanders said in a statement, first reported by NBC News, that he’s supporting Cooke to represent Wisconsin’s 3rd Congressional District because she will “stand up for working families and...
title: Sanders weighs into battleground district with Wisconsin endorsement

author: Debbie Wuthnow, opinion contributor
description: On June 19, Americans celebrate the emancipation of 250,000 slaves in Texas, while July 4th is a celebration of American independence, and African Americans like Benjamin Banneker, James Armistead Lafayette, and Jack "Prince" Sisson fought for freedom and justice.
title: Let's celebrate Black heroes of the American Revolution this Juneteenth

author: Tara Suter
description: Just under half of U.S. adults in a recent snap survey said they are against potential U.S. strikes in Iran. The snap poll, conducted by The Washington Post, found that 45 percent said they would not back “the U.S. military launching air strikes against Iran over its nuclear program,” while 25 percent said the opposite...
title: 45 percent against potential US strikes in Iran: Poll

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The State Department has begun evacuating nonessential government personnel and their families from Israel, as the conflict with Iran heats up and President Trump weighs greater U.S. involvement. A government plane departed from Israel Wednesday with diplomats and family members who had asked to leave the country, according to The Associated Press, which cited two...
title: US begins evacuations of nonessential personnel from Israel

author: John Tillman, opinion contributor
description: Democrats have historically been able to pass their agenda quickly, while Republicans have struggled to do so, with infighting and ideological divisions preventing meaningful progress.
title: To fulfill their promises to voters, Republicans must govern like Democrats

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Israel accused Iran of committing war crimes on Thursday after the latest barrage of missiles struck a hospital in southern Israel, as the warring nations close in on one week of fighting. Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz threatened to target Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei directly, in a post on social platform X responding...
title: Israel accuses Iran of war crimes after missile strikes hospital

description: Israeli President Benjamin Netanyahu said Iran would pay for targeting a civilian area of southern Israel on Thursday, with a missile hitting a hospital in Beersheba. No serious injuries were caused by the strike, but there was "extensive" damage. Israel "will exact the full price from the tyrants in Tehran," Netanyahu wrote on social platform...
title: Live updates: Israel seeks retribution as Iranian missile hits hospital

author: Lyndon Haviland, opinion contributor
description: Today, over 20 percent of doctors who practice in America were born outside the U.S., a number that has grown by 30 percent since 2004.
title: Trump’s deportation pause ignores vital immigrant health care workers

author: Tara Suter
description: A SpaceX rocket exploded late Wednesday during a static fire test, which the company attributed to "a major anomaly." “On Wednesday, June 18 at approximately 11 p.m. CT, the Starship preparing for the tenth flight test experienced a major anomaly while on a test stand at Starbase,” the aerospace company, owned by tech billionaire Elon...
title: SpaceX rocket explodes during test

author: Dov S. Zakheim, opinion contributor
description: As Israel continues to pummel Iran, President Trump and his team confront three major issues.
title: The US should aid Israel against Iran — but it should not enter their war

author: Taylor Delandro
description: Juneteenth marks the day in 1865 enslaved people in Galveston, Texas, found out they had been freed.
title: Is Juneteenth a paid holiday?

author: Tara Suter
description: Israel on Thursday revealed its latest strikes targeted "key sites" tied to Iran's nuclear and missile capabilities. The facilities struck included an inactive nuclear reactor in the city of Arak, a weapons development site near Natanz and ballistic missile and air defense production facilities, according to the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). “These facilities fuel Iran’s...
title: Israel claims strikes on Iranian nuclear, missile sites

author: Glenn Sacks, opinion contributor
description: Unions are doing exactly what we should be doing — standing up for our members and for workers as a whole against the enemies of labor.
title: Unions are right to stand with immigrants against ICE deportations

author: Mark Toth and Jonathan Sweet, opinion contributors
description: Team Trump may be on the verge of understanding that the U.S., NATO and their Pacific allies are being engulfed in a growing global war being waged against them by Russia and China.
title: For Team Trump, winning World War III begins in Iran and ends in Ukraine

author: Steph Whiteside
description: NASA has not offered much detail on the leak that has delayed a crew mission.
title: ISS leak delays mission, raises concerns at NASA

author: Jeff Arnold
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson blamed Democrats for what he says is their support of migrant criminals and not ICE agents.
title: Chicago braces for added ICE agents as standoff with Trump continues

description: “Nobody knows what I’m going to do"
title: Trump keeps Iran, lawmakers guessing

author: Jared Gans
description: Democrats and Republicans are having very different reactions when it comes to the arrest of a New York City mayoral candidate, with the former calling it out as an injustice and the latter arguing it's all political theater.  Brad Lander’s arrest by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents, which came while he was trying to...
title: Democrats, GOP clash over NYC mayoral candidate's arrest

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) is making an aggressive bid to win over Senate Republican colleagues who have balked at hundreds of billions of dollars in Medicaid spending cuts, hoping to clear obstacles in time to bring the bill to the floor next week. Thune is under pressure to speed up the pace of...
title: GOP leader aggressively woos GOP Medicaid holdouts on Trump bill

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The recent attacks on two Minnesota state lawmakers show the dangers of heightened political tensions are not just found on the national level but have impacts reaching state and local leaders, who tend to have more direct exposure to their constituents. “This has been going on for a long time in American politics: heated debate,...
title: Minnesota shootings highlight danger of political tensions at state, local levels

author: Aris Folley
description: Congress could soon put an end to work requirement exemptions for veterans, homeless individuals and youth that were in foster care who receive food assistance. While House Republicans preserved the exemptions to work requirements under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) as part of their broader package to advance President Trump’s tax cut and spending...
title: SNAP work requirement carveouts for vets, homeless caught in crosshairs of Trump bill

author: Robert Tulip, opinion contributor
description: A brighter Earth won’t solve every problem, but without it, every other climate effort will fall short.
title: Earth is absorbing too much sunlight: It’s a waking climate giant

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: An analysis by The Wilderness Society found that more than 250 million acres currently under the Bureau of Land Management and Forest Service are at risk of sale.
title: Proposed sale of millions of acres of public land under GOP budget bill prompts backlash

description: An analysis by The Wilderness Society found that more than 250 million acres currently under the Bureau of Land Management and Forest Service are at risk of sale.
